snippet: After a slowdown at the start of the year, the American economy picked up in April in tandem with the warming weather, expanding payrolls by 288,000, as the jobless rate fell to 6.3 percent.
abstract: Labor Department reports that employers added 288,000 jobs in April, best showing in more than two years; report, combined with other recent data, suggests that economy is poised to expand at a faster pace in coming months, after slow start in depths of winter.
lead_paragraph: After a slowdown at the start of the year, the American economy picked up in April in tandem with the warming weather, expanding payrolls by 288,000, as the jobless rate fell to 6.3 percent.

headline.main: Jump in Payrolls Is Seen as a Sign of New Optimism
headline.print_headline: Jump in Payrolls Is Seen as a Sign of New Optimism
